alert.note: Alert for Elbert; Madison; Oglethorpe (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 9:01PM EST until January 11 at 2:12AM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... Broad River near Broad River above Carlton affecting Elbert, Madison and Oglethorpe Counties. For the Broad River...including Broad River above Carlton...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and forecast to continue. * WHERE...Broad River near Broad River above Carlton. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 18 feet, Minor flooding will expand further into the woodlands and fields along the river upstream and downstream from the gage on the Georgia Highway 72 bridge. A sand dredge operation on the left bank near the gage will become flooded. A large portion of Roy Wood Road will be flooded with several feet of water and the Broad River Outpost for Canoes and Kayaks location will be under water. Flooding of the yard behind an assisted living home off of Roy Wood Road will continue to expand. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 PM EST Wednesday the stage was 17.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:45 PM EST Wednesday was 22.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late tomorrow morning and continue falling to 6 feet Monday evening. - Flood stage is 15 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 215 AM EST.
